H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5254.def: = action by which humans or deities make an effort to obtain information about (other) humans by observing them while they engage in a certain activity

H3811.def: = action by which humans spend all their forces on a certain activity

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H6113.def: = action by which someone slows down or stops moving forward entirely

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H1290.def: = central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength

H3766.def: = process by which humans or animals sink on their knees ◄ as a result of being unable to keep standing up

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3811.def: = action by which humans spend all their forces on a certain activity

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H926.def: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3690.def: = state where humans feel confident◄ due to their reliance on God or something else for protection

H8537.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H375.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H5397.def: = the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H7581.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion

H7826.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone

H5421.def: = causative action by which someone removes an object with force from the place to which it was attached

H3918.def: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} ≈ seen as a strong and fearless animal

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H6504.def: = process by which an object is split up into smaller units

H1589.def: = action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H8102.def: = words uttered very softly, usually without engaging one's vocal cords

H2384.def: = process by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H8639.def: = state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with having dreams and visions, sometimes with being inactive

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H7122.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H6342.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of strong emotions of joy, awe, or fear

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H8185.def: = the fine thread-like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals; ≈ one single strand can be used as a symbol for a very small distance or quantity, whereas the collective of strands often symbolizes a great quantity

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H4758.def: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

H1827.def: = a soft, hushed sound, if any sound at all, ≈ signifying the opposite of the loud noise produced by a storm, thunder, earthquakes etc.

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2891.def: = process by which an area or object becomes free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H8417.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which supernatural beings act wrongly, though not necessarily with the intention to do so

18.gl: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3247.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H6211.def: = smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction

H3807.def: = causative action by which humans use excessive power to break an object into little pieces

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H6153.def: = the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H5265.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

8.gl: to pull up (someone's) tent-cord > to cause someone to die
